column4: Dunno, i'm willing to take the chance though. Mind you, i'm more and more likely to actively disable my security etc. updates after this.
software isn't botany
genetic fallacy
Is there a way to find out what packages were updated?
sure just go to the Ubuntu Software Center and click on the "History" option
/var/log/apt contains a history of package installations
can you start X at all?
so you can run synaptic from the bash?
okay so you have GUI, got it
well in that case run synaptic package manager and go to "File->History"
When do you do the updates?
cool but when was the last time you run the update
I say this because if you know the date you updated when things got all broken you can uninstall all things installed on the date
and then if you are really keen you can run the update manager once again only this time install them one at a time and check each time if wine brakes
what kind of errors?
what happens when you ping a target?
I would type "sudo apt-get remove --purge 'package' -f
Harro dare
ooo, 4% packet loss is not so happy fun time
still it could be worse
have you done a trace route to see what is going on?
first you need to install traceroute
sudo apt-get install traceroute
that was a good time to use the /me command
